properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 7 at 1:53AM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
Three to four inches of rain, with potential for locally higher
amounts, is expected from Thursday through Saturday in southeast
Illinois and parts of east central Illinois. At this time, the
heaviest rainfall is expected Friday night into Saturday which
would produce the highest likelihood of flooding.

Although some uncertainty remains in amounts and location of the
heaviest rainfall, there is a high likelihood of heavy rainfall in
the region.

Flooding of low-lying and poorly drained areas, as well as low
water crossings, will be possible. Significant river flooding
problems may develop.

People with interests in or near flood prone areas should review
their preparedness plans for potential flooding late this week.

Please stay updated with the latest forecasts of this potentially
significant heavy rainfall and flooding event.

NWSheadline: Heavy rainfall and flooding potential Friday through Saturday
